header_summary:
Ben Westgate's integration proposal of BIP-0093 with BIP-0085 aims to enhance deterministic wallet backups and seed management by generating codex32 backups from BIP-0032 master keys. This approach leverages BIP-0085's deterministic entropy for codex32's human-readable formats, error correction, and secret sharing features, with a draft PR for Bitcoin Core signaling community support despite codex32's current limited adoption among wallets. The proposal, detailed in the respective BIP documents, represents a significant step towards standardized, secure seed backup solutions ([BIP-0093](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0093.mediawiki), [BIP-0085](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0085.mediawiki), [PR 32652](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32652?utm_source=chatgpt.com)).

The release of Bitcoin Core version v29.1rc2 highlights ongoing efforts to refine the cryptocurrency's software infrastructure. Available for community testing, this release candidate includes binaries and source code, emphasizing the importance of collaborative development and the iterative nature of open-source software. Feedback from this phase will contribute to the final version, underscoring the critical role of community participation in the software's evolution ([Bitcoin Core v29.1rc2](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.1/test.rc2/), [Release Notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v29.1rc2/doc/release-notes.md)).

Discussions surrounding Bitcoin's scripting language have led to proposals such as the introduction of *OP_EC_LIFT_X_EVEN* and *OP_EC_GENERATOR*. These suggestions aim to simplify elliptic curve operations within scripts, addressing current limitations and inaccuracies. The proposed changes could enhance script composability and the implementation of operations like *OP_TWEAKADD*, potentially refining Bitcoin's scripting capabilities and its overall transaction processing efficiency ([Scripting Language Proposal](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAO3Pvs-Cwj=5vJgBfDqZGtvmoYPMrpKYFAYHRb_EqJ5i0PG0cA@mail.gmail.com/T/#m47aca0b8c4a248d3be1637a936a32fbedd571068)).

The project bitcoinfuzz marks a significant advancement in security testing for Bitcoin and Lightning Network implementations. By employing differential fuzzing, the project has identified over 35 bugs across various components, underlining the importance of rigorous testing in ensuring protocol integrity. The collaborative effort, including contributions from Erick Cestari and Morehouse, and the potential integration into Google’s OSS-Fuzz, highlight the community's commitment to elevating the security standards of Bitcoin and Lightning Network infrastructures ([Bitcoinfuzz](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/the-state-of-bitcoinfuzz/1946)).

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Add BIP-0093 (Codex32) as application to BIP-0085
recent_posts.summary:
- Ben Westgate suggests merging BIP-0093 with BIP-0085 to improve deterministic wallet backups.
- Codex32, under BIP-93, aims for enhanced Shamir's Secret Sharing through error correction and secret sharing.
- The proposal encourages BIP-85 to generate codex32 backups, highlighting broader application and community feedback.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate 2 available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v29.1rc2 binaries are now available, indicating software progress.
- Users can test the new version via links to binaries and source code on GitHub.
- This release candidate invites community feedback to enhance Bitcoin Core's reliability.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces *OP_EC_LIFT_X_EVEN* to reverse *OP_EC_POINT_X_COORD*'s effects, aiding *OP_IKEY* use.
- It suggests adding *OP_EC_GENERATOR* to improve script composability by directly placing the generator point G on the stack.
- These enhancements aim to refine Bitcoin scripting for elliptic curve operations, correcting current procedures' inaccuracies.

recent_posts.title: A Game-Theoretic Approach to Bitcoin’s Valuation in Equilibrium
recent_posts.summary:
- The necessity of a unit like "Hayek" in perfect markets merits further exploration.
- Bitcoin challenges the inconsistency in academic valuation of digital versus traditional assets.
- Reevaluating Bitcoin under standard capital market assumptions could align academic assessments.

recent_posts.title: The state of bitcoinfuzz
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoinfuzz aims to enhance Bitcoin and Lightning Network security through differential fuzzing.
- The project has identified over 35 bugs in major protocols, improving system reliability.
- Future plans include integrating with OSS-Fuzz and expanding fuzzing capabilities and targets.

recent_posts.title: Taking a second look at OP_EXPIRE
recent_posts.summary:
- MEV raises concerns about miners ignoring transactions, potentially leading to fund loss.
- Selfish mining and hardware differences between Bitcoin and Monero complicate MEV's impact.
- Proposals suggest transaction expiration alternatives without altering Bitcoin's consensus mechanism.

today_in_history_posts.title: Statechain coinswap: assigning blame for failure in a two-stage transfer protocol.
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A new protocol for off-chain coin-swaps with statechain integration is being developed.
- The protocol ensures owner custody throughout the swap, using a blind signature for anonymity.
- Addressing the challenge of blame in failed swaps remains, with a focus on a simpler solution.

today_in_history_posts.title: Why should funders always pay on-chain fees?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests allowing fundees to pay part of the commit-tx fees in the Lightning Network.
- It introduces the idea of charging fees based on the number of HTLCs offered by each node.
- Concerns include potential negative impacts and the complexity of implementing the new fee structure.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin aims for 1 billion users with off-chain "bitcoin banks" and coinpools for scalability.
- High transaction costs prompt a move to semi-trusted off-chain entities for improved affordability and security.
- Networking off-chain entities with sound policies can ensure regulatory compliance and align with Bitcoin's scalability and security goals.
